0.Pros: Its a good first job. In my location the managers do care and it makes a huge difference at work. It will teach you how the working world functions and is a very easy way to get yourself out there. If you show up and make an effort, they'll keep you.
0.Cons: Whether you have hours or not will depend on "labor", and there are a lot of teenagers and adults who come here expecting to not come to work and still have a job. Your work environment depends on your managers, not a pro or con, but something to keep in mind.

1.Pros: Great hours, Benefits, Ability to transfer
1.Cons: Nothing comes to mind. Really great place

2.Pros: Easy access to solid work hours

3.Pros: They was nothing good about working here
3.Cons: Every possible con you can thing of

4.Pros: My coworkers were like my best friends,
4.Cons: As the years went on, everyone began leaving and crappy people replaced. Store went to crap after that. Everything sucks in this company. Great first job but not after that

5.Pros: Free Food , flexible schedule, and decent hours
5.Cons: Bad Management, bad pay and no breaks

8.Summary: "My experience was really good overall. I enjoyed working with my coworkers there & the managers are understanding."
8.Pros: Great team! The crew is really helpful in training you to become one of them. Great management. Great enviroment to work in
8.Cons: Every now & then you come across a rude customer. Other times you get really specific orders from customers so you have to pay extra attention to them to meet their needs.

9.Pros: A lot of opportunities to grow
9.Cons: I have no opinion for cons
